tn.ref: the fourth ... the first
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: all the people of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem
tn.text: These were the last of the Israelites. The northern kingdom had already fallen.

tn.ref: Amon
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: until this day
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:07:24|7:24]].

tn.ref: Yahweh's words have been coming to me
tn.text: AT: "Yahweh has given me his words to proclaim to you"

tn.ref: They were eager to go out
tn.text: AT: "They were eager to share God's words with you"

tn.ref: listen or pay attention
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:11:06|11:8]].

tn.ref: his wicked way and the corruption of his practices
tn.text: The terms "wicked way" and "corruption of his practices" mean the same thing and refer to every sinful thing that they do. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: return to the land that Yahweh gave in ancient times to your ancestors and to you, as a permanent gift
tn.text: AT: "so that you can return to the land Yahweh promised to you and live in it forever"

tn.ref: do not provoke him with the work of your hands so that he does you harm
tn.text: AT: "do not make Yahweh angry with your evil works so he will punish you"

tn.ref: you have not listened to me
tn.text: AT: "you have not obeyed me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: and bring them against this land
tn.text: God plans to use Nebuchadnezzar and his arms to punish Israel and surrounding nations for their rebellion against Yahweh.

tn.ref: see
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:17|1:18]].

tn.ref: hissing
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:18:15|18:16]].

tn.ref: millstones
tn.text: These are two large, round stones used to grind grain.

tn.ref: I will make all these things disappear from these nations
tn.text: This is a reference to the nations being destroyed. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: these nations will serve the king of Babylon
tn.text: Be forced to pay tribute and sold into slavery.

tn.ref: have been completed
tn.text: AT: "when their punishment is complete"

tn.ref: make it an unending desolation
tn.text: God vows to turn Babylon into a desert like wilderness.

tn.ref: I will repay them for their deeds and the works of their hands
tn.text: God will cause them to receive the same punishment they inflicted on the nations they conquered.

tn.ref: their deeds and the works of their hands
tn.text: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize that Yahweh is referring to everything that they have done to other nations. AT: "everything that they have done." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: cup of the wine of fury from my hand and make all the nations to which I am sending you drink it
tn.text: Yahweh is commanding punishment to start. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: make all the nations to which I am sending you drink it
tn.text: AT: "make the nations experience it"

tn.ref: they will drink and then stumble about and rant madly before the sword that I am sending out among them
tn.text: Those experiencing the consequences of Yahweh's severe punishment will act like crazy people.

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: This passage continues the metaphor of Yahweh's wrath as a drink to be poured out.

tn.ref: I made all the nations to which Yahweh had sent me drink it
tn.text: The action of drinking from the cup of wine symbolized God's judgment.

tn.ref: to turn them into ruins and something terrifying
tn.text: AT: "to destroy them"

tn.ref: for hissing and cursing
tn.text: AT: "to be despised or cursed"

tn.ref: they are at this present day
tn.text: There was apparently a period of time between when this was written and when it actually happened.

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Jeremiah lists all the nations that were to be judged (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: people of mixed heritage
tn.text: This is a reference to people with two parents from two different nations. AT: "mixed people"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Jeremiah continues to list all the nations that were under God's judgment. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: the sea
tn.text: This is a reference to the Mediterranean Sea.

tn.ref: the ones who cut the hair on the sides of their heads
tn.text: This is probably a reference to Arabians who lived in the desert, people who cut their hair short in order to honor a pagan god. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: drink it
tn.text: This refers to the cup of wine in Jeremiah's vision that is symbolic of God's judgment.

tn.ref: Zimri
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: the kings of the north
tn.text: AT: "the kings from the north"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: The vision that God gave to the prophet Jeremiah continues.

tn.ref: Drink and become drunk, then vomit, fall down, and do not rise before the sword that I am sending among you.
tn.text: This shows the inevitability of the coming punishment and the futility of trying to avoid it.

tn.ref: the cup from your hand to drink
tn.text: AT: "their punishment"

tn.ref: You must certainly drink it
tn.text: This is not a cup that nations can refuse to drink. Nations can not refuse God's Judgments of war and natural disasters.

tn.ref: drink it
tn.text: AT: be punished" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the city that is called by my name
tn.text: AT: "the people of Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: should you yourselves be free from punishment?
tn.text: AT: "you are to be punished." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: I am calling a sword against all the inhabitants of the land
tn.text: AT: "I am punishing those who live in the land"

tn.ref: to bring a lawsuit
tn.text: AT: "to convict the nations" or "to judge and punish the nations"

tn.ref: He will administer justice to all flesh
tn.text: All the known nations will experience God's judgment.

tn.ref: to all flesh
tn.text: AT: "to all mankind" or "to all people"

tn.ref: hand over the wicked ones to the sword
tn.text: AT: "kill the evil people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: See
tn.text: AT: "Pay attention to this!" See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:05:14|5:14]]

tn.ref: a great storm is beginning from the farthest parts of the earth
tn.text: AT: "destruction is coming" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: will on that day extend from one end of the earth to the other
tn.text: AT: "will on that day cover the entire earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: They will be like dung on the ground
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) there were few or no people left to bury those whom Yahweh had killed or 2) there was a total lack of concern for the bodies of the dead. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: shepherds
tn.text: This is a reference to leaders of Israel.

tn.ref: Roll about on the ground
tn.text: This is a sign of sorrow, mourning or distress.

tn.ref: For your day
tn.text: AT: For your time" or "the time for you"

tn.ref: You will fall like chosen rams.
tn.text: AT: "You will easily be destroyed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: Refuge for the shepherds is gone
tn.text: There will be no hiding place to escape this judgment or destruction.

tn.ref: Yahweh is devastating their pastures
tn.text: God's Judgment is on both the leaders and the people, no one will be spared.

tn.ref: So the peaceful pastures will be devastated
tn.text: Here "pastures" stands for the entire nation. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: will be devastated
tn.text: This can be put into active form. AT: "he will devastate the entire nation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: angry wrath
tn.text: The fact that Yahweh is angry is spoken of as if it were an object. AT: "Yahweh is angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: Like a young lion, he has left his den, for their land will become a horror
tn.text: Unlike other references where God is viewed as a protective lion toward Israel, in this passage God acts like a lion in order to punish Israel. AT: "Yahweh is coming like a young lion to make the people's land a horror" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: their land will become a horror
tn.text: Here "horror" stands for a quality. AT: "their land will become horrible" or "their land will become something fearful to see" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: the oppressor's anger
tn.text: This refers to the anger of Israel's enemies.
